channel.title: Adding listneres to JLists
channel.description: Hey, I was wondering if I could get some help with adding a listener to a JList. I have looked around but all the examples seem overly complicated. What I want to do is get the selected entry when the user clicks the list. I have used listeners before, but only with buttons and checkboxes and things.

item.title: Adding listneres to JLists
item.dc:creator: @Uru_Wolf Uru Wolf
item.description:
@Uru_Wolf wrote:

I will upload the file with this post. I’m afraid that it’s only half commented. I don’t think I have the version that was orrignally causing the error. I really just need someone to explain them to me.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 16, 2008, 02:14:31 am[/size][hr]Don’t worry. I have it now. It’s not really coded in a way that I would choose, it looks kinda messy…but it’s working. Among other things I needed some imports >_<[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 17, 2008, 01:46:23 am[/size][hr]Ok, I have a new problem that I would like some help with. I was wondering how to remove all items from a list then replace it with a new set from an array.

So far I have got:

boards.getSelectionModel().clearSelection(); boards.getSelectionModel().removeIndexInterval(0, e.getLastIndex());
As far as my understanding goes this should remove the selection then empty the list. The selection is removed but nothing else happens.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 17, 2008, 02:58:59 am[/size][hr]Don’t worry about it. I have sorted it out. ^^ Just had to use “setListData()” XD[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 21, 2008, 03:23:16 am[/size][hr]Ok, after sorting this all out I have encountered another problem. After updating one of my lists the listener fails to reload on the reconstructed list. I am re-adding the listener with .setListSelectionListener() but nothing is happening.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding listneres to JLists
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Uru Wolf, post:7, topic:236663”]Yea, that is the same tutorial that I orrignaly followed. I will take another look but I would prefer something like the ActionPerformed listener for buttons and things, just implement, add listener and override the method.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 15, 2008, 12:08:13 pm[/size][hr]I had another look at the java tutorial. I have basically the same code that they are using in the ListSelectionDemo.java example. I am still getting an error on compile:

Compiling 1 source file to /home/steven/NetBeansProjects/jaross/build/classes /home/steven/NetBeansProjects/jaross/src/jaross/Editor.java:76: addListSelectionListener(javax.swing.event.ListSelectionListener) in javax.swing.ListSelectionModel cannot be applied to (jaross.SharedListSelectionHandler) colListMod.addListSelectionListener(new SharedListSelectionHandler()); 1 error BUILD FAILED (total time: 0 seconds)
(Yes I am using netbeans, not for the buttons and shiny things though.)
I get no code errors from netbeans (no red lines)

Oh yea, I’m looking at this: http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/uiswing/events/listselectionlistener.html page[/quote]

Can we see more code?

Read full topic

item.title: Adding listneres to JLists
item.dc:creator: @Uru_Wolf Uru Wolf
item.description:
@Uru_Wolf wrote:

Yea, that is the same tutorial that I orrignaly followed. I will take another look but I would prefer something like the ActionPerformed listener for buttons and things, just implement, add listener and override the method.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 15, 2008, 12:08:13 pm[/size][hr]I had another look at the java tutorial. I have basically the same code that they are using in the ListSelectionDemo.java example. I am still getting an error on compile:

Compiling 1 source file to /home/steven/NetBeansProjects/jaross/build/classes /home/steven/NetBeansProjects/jaross/src/jaross/Editor.java:76: addListSelectionListener(javax.swing.event.ListSelectionListener) in javax.swing.ListSelectionModel cannot be applied to (jaross.SharedListSelectionHandler) colListMod.addListSelectionListener(new SharedListSelectionHandler()); 1 error BUILD FAILED (total time: 0 seconds)
(Yes I am using netbeans, not for the buttons and shiny things though.)
I get no code errors from netbeans (no red lines)

Oh yea, I’m looking at this: http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/uiswing/events/listselectionlistener.html page

Read full topic

item.title: Adding listneres to JLists
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

add a mouse listener then do jListInstance.getSelectedIndex()

although there might be a swing listener that does a similar thing
